subject: Re: [junit] use of setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: ... For what it s worth I do almost exactly this. However I do reparse on every test method, and it s not that big a deal. The key is that I do the reparse for
messageBody:
Cedric Beust wrote:

> Hint: imagine the XML file is several megabytes big. It's not that far
> fetched, really.

For what it's worth I do almost exactly this. However I do reparse on
every test method, and it's not that big a deal. The key is that I do
the reparse for large files in each test method rather than in setUp or
the constructor so that those methods that don't need to parse the file
don't do it. That's all the performance bump I need to make the tests
run quickly enough.

--
Elliotte Rusty Harold elharo@...
